commText: Prabhsimran and Bairstow are at the crease. Prabhsimran is on strike. Swapnil Singh will open the attack
Swapnil Singh to Prabhsimran, 2 runs, floated full outside off, Prabhsimran creams the drive to the left of cover, a diving stop by Jacks in the deep prevents the boundary
Swapnil Singh to Prabhsimran, no run, quicker on off, nudged away into the leg-side
Swapnil Singh to Prabhsimran, FOUR, full and drifting down leg, Prabhsimran stays low and helps it away with a neat paddle past the keeper to his left
Swapnil Singh to Prabhsimran, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!

Swapnil Singh to Prabhsimran, out Lbw!! Dead. Prabhsimran has a word with his partner and he's been advised against the review. The surprise slider from Swapnil Singh, drifted in with the arm and went straight on to hit Prabhsimran plumb in front of middle stump. Prabhsimran was on the back foot and had no clue, didn't pick it and paid the price. Prabhsimran lbw b Swapnil Singh 6(4) [4s-1]
Rilee Rossouw, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Swapnil Singh to Rossouw, FOUR, tosses it full outside off, Rossouw slices the drive past the diving fielder at backward point to his left
Swapnil Singh to Rossouw, FOUR, too full outside off, Rossouw smashes the drive off the strong bottom hand and beats the fielder at extra cover to his left
Mohammed Siraj, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Siraj to Bairstow, no run, full and shaping in towards off, Bairstow pins the drive to the left of the bowler
Siraj to Bairstow, FOUR, short and wide of off, ample time on the back foot for Bairstow to swat the pull off the top-edge to the right of mid-wicket
Siraj to Bairstow, no run, I0$ skiddy length delivery on the stumps, Bairstow looks to hit leg-side and gets it off the splice into the off-side
Siraj to Bairstow, 1 run, short and wide of off, slapped away to deep backward point
Most wickets among spinners in Powerplay in IPL 2024 4 Swapnil Singh 3 Rashid Khan 2 Varun Chakravarthy 2 Shahbaz Ahmed
Siraj to Rossouw, 1 run, I0$ yorker on and around leg stump, Rossouw trips over trying to flick leg-side and looks like he's got an inside edge onto boot on that

Siraj to Bairstow, 1 run, I0$ length outside off, Bairstow heaves it to the right of Faf and mid-off and hurries across for a quick single. Direct hit from Faf as he caught Bairstow with both feet up inside the air. However, to PBKS' delight, Bairstow already crossed the guide line before hopping to avoid being hit by the ball...
Yash Dayal, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Yash Dayal to Bairstow, 1 run, full outside off, Bairstow pushes the drive to mid-off for a quick single

Yash Dayal to Rossouw, FOUR, yorker length on leg stump, Rossouw looks to squeeze and gets a thick inside edge that dribbles away to the left of fine leg, beating the desperate dive of Siraj in the deep
Yash Dayal to Rossouw, no run, full and angling away outside off, Rossouw drives and gets beaten on the outside edge
Yash Dayal to Rossouw, no run, walks across and mistimes the drive to the right of mid-on

Yash Dayal to Rossouw, 1 run, dropped. Slower length delivery outside off, Rossouw sat down on one knee looking for a late cut and guided it straight into the hands of Lomror at backward point who ends up shelling it
Yash Dayal to Bairstow, no run, full outside off, Bairstow squeezes the drive to extra cover
Siraj to Rossouw, FOUR, length delivery sits up nicely outside off at I0$, Rossouw stands tall and slashes it away square on the off-side. Raced away...
Siraj to Rossouw, no run, full and angling away outside off. Rossouw looks to slog leg-side and gets beaten on the outside edge
Siraj to Rossouw, FOUR, too full outside off, Rossouw biffs the drive past the non-striker and beats mid-off to his left. Plenty of bottom hand power on that shot...
Siraj to Rossouw, no run, looks to swipe a short of length delivery over mid-wicket but gets beaten for pace this time around
Siraj to Rossouw, FOUR, comes dancing down the wicket, meets the ball on a fuller length and drills it past the diving left hand of Faf at mid-off

Siraj to Rossouw, SIX, nailed! This was the shot he missed a couple of times in this over. A I0$ juicy length delivery in the slot outside off, Rossouw swivels and heaves it deep into the mid-wicket stands. 18 off the over
Yash Dayal to Bairstow, SIX, I0$ gentle length delivery outside off, Bairstow dismisses it out of his sight with a cracking pull over mid-wicket for an 85-metre maximum
Yash Dayal to Bairstow, FOUR, Yash Dayal goes full and in the zone outside off, Bairstow exrends his arms on the loft and slices it over the infield on the off-side
Yash Dayal to Bairstow, wide, low full toss drifting down leg at I0$, Bairstow looks to flick and misses
Yash Dayal to Bairstow, no run, yorker length on the stumps, Bairstow looks to squeeze it into the leg-side and gets an inside edge onto his boot
Yash Dayal to Bairstow, no run, I0$ full and outside leg stump, Bairstow flicks but can't beat the fielder at short fine to his left

Yash Dayal to Bairstow, 1 run, back of the hand slower length delivery just outside off at I0$, Bairstow didn't pick it till the last second and somehow manages to get some bat on the attempted poke into the off-side
Yash Dayal to Rossouw, FOUR, slower length delivery outside off at I0$, Rossouw swivels and muscles the pull over the fielder at mid-on to his right
Lockie Ferguson, right-arm fast, comes into the attack
Ferguson to Bairstow, 1 run, full outside off, Bairstow opens the bat face and steers it to the left of backward point
Ferguson to Rossouw, 1 run, short of length on middle and leg at I0$, Rossouw swivels and drags the pull off the inside half to the left of deep mid-wicket
Ferguson to Bairstow, FOUR, overpitched on off, Bairstow mistimes the drive but gets enough power to clear the fielder at mid-on
Ferguson to Bairstow, FOUR, fuller and angled into the pads, Bairstow slogs and gets it off the thik inside half that races away behind square on the leg-side
Ferguson to Bairstow, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Ferguson to Bairstow, out Caught by du Plessis!! Ferguson has the last laugh. Bowls a slower full delivery outside off and lures Bairstow into a mistimed loft. Chips it off the toe end and Faf does well to run back and complete the catch from mid-off. He started running backwards soon as the ball went up in the air and pulled off a well-timed dive at the last moment to gather control over the catch. Bairstow c du Plessis b Ferguson 27(16) [4s-4 6s-1]
Shashank Singh, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Ferguson to Shashank Singh, FOUR, Shashank Singh opens his account with a boundary. Drifting on the pads and Shashank flicks it through square leg to get going

Timeout! Punjab Kings have gotten off to a brisk start, however, they still have a long way to go. The required run rate is close to the 12-run mark, so they need to keep dealing in boundaries going forward..

Powerplay summary -- Swapnil traps Prabhsimran LBW in first over -- Rossouw off to a flier -- Lomror drops Rossouw on 13 (2.5) -- Siraj taken for 18 in his 2nd over by Rossouw -- Dayal taken for 16 in his 2nd over -- Bairstow dismissed by Ferguson slower ball for 27 (5.5)
Will Jacks, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
Will Jacks to Rossouw, 1 run, touch slower on middle and leg, nudged through square leg for a single
Highest Powerplay total in IPL games in Dharamsala
Will Jacks to Shashank Singh, 1 run, darted on middle and leg, keeps a touch low, Shashank Singh works it through mid-wicket for a single
Will Jacks to Rossouw, 1 run, a lot slower through the air, Rossouw works it with soft hands to the leg-side
Will Jacks to Shashank Singh, 1 run, darted on middle and leg, nudged to long-on for a single
Will Jacks to Rossouw, 1 run, full and straight on middle, Rossouw clips it through square leg for a single
Will Jacks to Shashank Singh, no run, lovely over by Will Jacks. Full and straight on off, Shashank Singh drives it crisply to cover
Cameron Green, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Green to Rossouw, no run, back of a length on off, punched to cover by Rossouw
Green to Rossouw, FOUR, banged in short by Green, Rossouw goes for a pull and gets a top edge that flies over the keeper, much needed boundary for PBKS

Green to Rossouw, SIX, Rossouw brings up his fifty with a maximum! Green goes full and Rossouw stands tall and thumps it over the bowler's head for half-a-dozen. Has been a superb knock this. Needs to convert this into a formidable score does Rossouw
Green to Rossouw, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Rossouw plays it late, guides it to third man for a single

Green to Shashank Singh, FOUR, Shashank Singh joins the party. Walks across in the crease and goes for a pull against this short ball. Gets hit on the glove as the ball rolls away to the fine leg fence
Green to Shashank Singh, 1 run, an expensive over by Green. Back of a length on middle and leg, worked to mid-wicket for a single
Karn Sharma, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
Karn Sharma to Shashank Singh, 1 run, tad short on middle and leg, worked through the on-side by Shashank Singh for a single

Karn Sharma to Rossouw, FOUR, 100 up for PBKS! Rossouw keeping them alive in the run chase. A short and wide ball outside off, Rossouw throws his hands at it, smashing it through cover for a rollicking boundary
Karn Sharma to Rossouw, SIX, massive! Goes down on his knee and smokes this tossed up delivery over deep mid-wicket for a huge maximum. Karn Sharma under pressure
Karn Sharma to Rossouw, no run, tad short on off, punched off the back foot to cover by Rossouw

Karn Sharma to Rossouw, no run, googly around off, Rossouw goes for a reverse sweep, gets hit on the throat as the ball deflects off the forearm. The physio is out in the middle to have a check on the batter
STAT: Second 50+ score for Rossouw in IPL. The first one also came at the same venue last year - 82* for DC vs PBKS.
Karn Sharma to Rossouw, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Karn Sharma to Rossouw, out Caught by Will Jacks!! Karn Sharma strikes, gets the set batsman. This was a tad short and Rossouw went for the aerial route once again. Pulls it towards long-on and Will Jacks in the deep completes a regulation catch. Conceded a boundary and a six earlier in the over but Karn Sharma bounces back and removes Rossouw. Rossouw c Will Jacks b Karn Sharma 61(27) [4s-9 6s-3]
Jitesh Sharma, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Swapnil Singh [1.0-0-14-1] is back into the attack
Swapnil Singh to Shashank Singh, no run, advances down the track and pushes the floated delivery to the fielder at cover

Swapnil Singh to Shashank Singh, FOUR, cheeky. Got beaten due to the spin but adjusts well to beat the fielder at short third man. Played it late and with soft hands as the outside edge makes it way to the third man fence
Swapnil Singh to Shashank Singh, no run, full and straight at the stumps, Shashank Singh defends it from within the crease
Swapnil Singh to Shashank Singh, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Shashank Singh cuts it to point where the fielder stops it with a dive
Swapnil Singh to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, advances down the wicket and smashes this flatter delivery past the bowler
Swapnil Singh to Shashank Singh, 1 run, fraction short on middle and leg, worked towards mid-wicket for a single
Karn Sharma to Shashank Singh, SIX, gets hold of this short ball and clubs it over deep square leg for an enormous six. Went miles up in the air and cleared the fence
Karn Sharma to Shashank Singh, 1 run, darted on the pads, worked towards the leg-side for a single

Karn Sharma to Jitesh Sharma, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Jitesh Sharma throws the kitchen sink at it, gets an outside edge that clears the fielder at short third man, in fact there were a couple of fielders who was charging back
Karn Sharma to Jitesh Sharma, no run, quicker through the air on off, Jitesh Sharma knocks it into the off-side
Karn Sharma to Jitesh Sharma, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

Karn Sharma to Jitesh Sharma, out Bowled!! Cleaned him up! A perfect leg-break by Karn Sharma, Jitesh goes down on his knee to play the slogsweep, gets beaten all ends up. The stumps have been rattled and Karn Sharma has his second wicket. They are scoring boundaries but also losing wickets. Jitesh Sharma b Karn Sharma 5(4) [4s-1]
Liam Livingstone, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Karn Sharma to Livingstone, no run, Karn Sharma goes full as Livingstone drives it back to the bowler
Swapnil Singh to Shashank Singh, 1 run, played towards mid-wicket by Shashank Singh for a single
Swapnil Singh to Livingstone, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Swapnil Singh to Livingstone, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! Another one bites the dust. This one grips into the surface and turns away sharply, Livingstone was trying to work it across the line but the leading edge flew straight to Karn Sharma at cover. RCB back on top again. Livingstone c Karn Sharma b Swapnil Singh 0(2)
Sam Curran, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Swapnil Singh to Sam Curran, 2 runs, tad short on off, Sam Curran punches it to wide long-off where the fielder stops it with a slide
Swapnil Singh to Sam Curran, FOUR, on the shorter side, Sam Curran picks the length early and whips this through mid-wicket for a rollicking boundary, his first one of the innings
Swapnil Singh to Sam Curran, no run, full and wide outside off, Sam Curran mistimes his drive to cover
Swapnil Singh to Sam Curran, no run, short and wide outside off, punched to Faf at cover, excellent diving stop that by the RCB captain
Karn Sharma to Shashank Singh, SIX, huge blow. Right into the slot on middle and leg, Shashank Singh goes down on his knee and slogsweeps this over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen
Karn Sharma to Shashank Singh, 1 run, googly on middle and leg, worked through square leg by Shashank Singh for a single
Karn Sharma to Sam Curran, 2 runs, a lot slower through the air, Sam Curran works it towards the leg-side and a fumble by the fielder charging in allows them the second
Karn Sharma to Sam Curran, no run, shimmies down the wicket and pushes the floated delivery back to the bowler
Karn Sharma to Sam Curran, 1 run, flatter delivery on off, Sam Curran knocks it to long-on for a single

Karn Sharma to Shashank Singh, FOUR, another productive over for PBKS. This was wide outside off and spinning away from the batter. Shashank Singh goes hard at it and gets an outside edge that beats the fielder at short third. 14 runs from the over. 96 runs required in 42 balls
Lockie Ferguson [1.0-0-14-1] is back into the attack
Ferguson to Sam Curran, 1 run, sensible batting as Sam Curran hands over the strike to the set batsman, works this through mid-wicket
Ferguson to Shashank Singh, leg byes, 1 run, short of a length on middle and leg, Shashank Singh looks to whip it away, gets an inside edge on to the pads. A quick run taken

Ferguson to Sam Curran, 2 runs, short of a length on middle and leg, nudged through the leg-side by Sam Curran for a couple of runs.. Looks like Shashank has hurt his shoulder. He collided with Faf du Plessis after completing the second run. The physio is having a check on him
Ferguson to Sam Curran, THATS OUT!! Run Out!!

Ferguson to Sam Curran, out Shashank Singh Run Out!! 1 run completed. That's a fantastic throw by Kohli. Charges in from deep mid-wicket, gathers the ball and fires in a direct-hit at the bowler's end. Shashank is short of his crease and that's a run-out. Was a shortish delivery that was played with soft hands by Sam Curran. Shashank Singh run out (Kohli) 37(19) [4s-4 6s-2]
Ashutosh Sharma, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Ferguson to Sam Curran, 1 run, pitched up by the bowler on off, Sam Curran drives it to cover for a single. A direct-hit at the bowler's end would have made things interesting
Ferguson to Ashutosh Sharma, leg byes, 1 run, short of a length on leg, off the thigh towards the on-side as they take a leg bye
Mohammed Siraj [2.0-0-25-0] is back into the attack
Siraj to Ashutosh Sharma, 1 run, on a length around off, Ashutosh Sharma drives it to mid-off for a single
Siraj to Sam Curran, 1 run, low full toss on off, Sam Curran looks to whip it away, gets a single at long-on
Siraj to Ashutosh Sharma, SIX, impressive. He's quite capable of playing these shots. This was a short ball and Ashutosh Sharma helps it over fine leg for half-a-dozen. 80m maximum!
Siraj to Ashutosh Sharma, 1 run, slower back of a length delivery on off, Ashutosh Sharma pats it towards cover for a single
Siraj to Sam Curran, wide, short and wide outside off, misses the tramline by a long way
Siraj calls for the physio as he's struggling with something
Siraj to Sam Curran, 1 run, quick length delivery on middle, nudged through mid-wicket for one
Ashutosh Sharma has been adjudged lbw and he has reviewed the umpire's call!
Siraj to Ashutosh Sharma, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!

Siraj to Ashutosh Sharma, out Lbw!! RCB inch closer to victory. A full and quick delivery on middle and leg, Ashutosh Sharma looks to flick it away and gets rapped on the pads. Nothing on UltraEdge, no bat involved and it's clipping the leg-stump. PBKS won't lose the review but they have lost their seventh wicket. Ashutosh Sharma lbw b Siraj 8(5) [6s-1]

Highlights (Overs 7-15) -- 89/5, 9.9rpo -- PBKS lose their way as wickets tumble -- Rossouw raises fifty off 21 balls (7.3) -- Rossouw holes out for 61 off Karn (8.6) -- Jitesh cleaned up by Karn for 5 (10.5) -- Livingstone dismissed for a duck by Swapnil (11.2) -- Shashank run out for 37 (13.4) -- Ashutosh trapped LBW by Siraj for 8 (14.6)
Harshal Patel, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Ferguson to Sam Curran, 2 runs, pitched up by the bowler, Sam Curran flicks it towards deep mid-wicket and takes a couple of runs
Ferguson to Sam Curran, FOUR, edged but safe! Short of a length around off, some extra carry as the outside edge flies past the fielder at short third man
Ferguson to Sam Curran, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

Ferguson to Sam Curran, out Bowled!! Knocked him over! This is getting over rather quickly. Ferguson goes full on off, Sam Curran has a swing and a miss. The off pole has been rattled as RCB are two wickets away from an emphatic win. Sam Curran b Ferguson 22(16) [4s-2]
Timeout! Just a matter of time now. RCB in for a massive win with only 2 wickets remaining...
Rahul Chahar, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Ferguson to Rahul Chahar, no run, on the shorter side, Rahul Chahar defends it from within the crease
Ferguson to Rahul Chahar, no run, short and quick on off, Rahul Chahar goes for a pull, connects thin air
Ferguson to Rahul Chahar, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Rahul Chahar plays this late, slashes it away to the square third man fence
Siraj to Harshal Patel, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Siraj to Harshal Patel, out Caught by Ferguson!! Wickets falling down like nine pins. This was a full length delivery and Harshal Patel flicks it straight to the fielder at deep backward square leg. Ferguson completes the formalities near the boundary. Harshal Patel c Ferguson b Siraj 0(1)
Arshdeep Singh, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Siraj to Arshdeep Singh, 2 wides, banged in short by Siraj, over the batter's head as DK fails to gather it
Siraj to Rahul Chahar, no run, pitched up by the bowler, Rahul Chahar has a swing and a miss
Siraj to Rahul Chahar, 1 run, yorker length delivery on leg, Rahul Chahar digs it towards mid-on for one
Siraj to Arshdeep Singh, no run, on a length around off, Arshdeep Singh swings hard, mistimes it to mid-wicket
Siraj to Arshdeep Singh, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Arshdeep Singh reaches out for it with a stretch and slices it to square third man for four runs
Siraj to Arshdeep Singh, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Siraj to Arshdeep Singh, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! Siraj finishes off with a 3-wicket haul. RCB win! A slower delivery on off, fraction short and Arshdeep Singh looks to take him on. Swings hard, miscues it towards mid-on and Karn Sharma charges in to complete a safe catch. Handshakes between the players as RCB have managed to register a clinical victory. Arshdeep Singh c Karn Sharma b Siraj 4(3) [4s-1]

23:41 Local Time, 18:11 GMT, 23:41 IST: RCB register their fourth consecutive win of the season and stay alive in the tournament. Punjab Kings have been eliminated. Earlier in the day, RCB were put in to bat first by Curran and the Challengers put up a fantastic batting performance. There were several dropped catches by the PBKS fielders and RCB batters made them pay for those dropped chances. Patidar notched up a brisk fifty, while Kohli smashed 92. In reply, Bairstow and Rossouw had a brisk partnership in the powerplay, however, once that partnership was broken, wickets kept tumbling for the rest of the innings. There were a couple of handy knocks by PBKS batters thereafter but it was a collective effort by the RCB bowlers that gave them an emphatic 60-run victory. Stay around for the presentations..

Swapnil Singh: Enjoyed a lot. Initially the ball was swinging, so the thought was to swing the ball. Actually the pressure is less because everyone is going for runs. Mentally it is relaxing to think about it. After the first half (of the tournament) we had a meeting. In that we discussed we haven't used our spinners as effectively as we could. So we started doing that better. As we are on a roll, things are like we have to hit our own areas and plan against batters.

Sam Curran | PBKS skipper: A lot of positive signs throughout the season, but not enough to get over the line unfortunately. We knew that we had the best side for the rest of the tournament and feel gutted for the team. Gotta keep our heads up, keep learning and keep becoming better. Really enjoyed leading a great bunch of guys, would have loved a few more wins. We had some highs, and some record run-chases as well,. Lots of disappointment and apologize to the fans, we will keep fighting. The ups and downs have been quite tough, but you gotta keep learning and keep working hard.

du Plessis | RCB skipper: That was a good game. We have scored 200-plus in the last 5-6 games. We have had good conversations, we were making the same mistakes over and over again. Needed aggression with the bat. We just spoke about taking wickets. We have 6-7 options in the bowling department. You need some form in your side. With a bit of luck is also required. We had a few guys looking for wickets and runs at the start of the tournament. The boys have shown character to turn it around. Everyone has chipped in with runs and the bowlers are taking wickets. For us it's important to focus on ourselves.We want to stick to the style of play that we want to do, if we do that it'll prove we are a really good team.

Virat Kohli | Player of the Match: For me it’s still quality over quantity, more so now at this stage of my career. Me being 35, heading into 36 - for me quality over quantity works really well. The understanding of the game for so many years allows you to practice less but still stay mentally switched on, that’s something I try to replicate in every practice session I go through. And some added challenges in terms of improving your own game, certain aspects of the game you want to get better at. It’s an ever-evolving process, I am certainly not a guy who wants to sit around saying this is the way I play and not improve on things I need to. I brought out the slog-sweep to the spinners. I just mentally put myself in that situation, never practiced it at all. I know I can hit it (slog-sweep) because I have hit it in the past. I need to take a bit more risks. That’s allowing me to hit that shot off the back foot as well. I have tried to expose that side of the field as well, which for me has been a massive factor in this IPL. I think it needs a bit more conviction to take out that thought, what if I get out. I am managing to stay ahead of that thought in this IPL and that is really helping me in the middle overs to keep the strike rate up and keeping the scoring rate going for the team as well. The only way to go through a long tournament is to absolutely be honest with yourselves. We were just not good enough in the first half of the tournament, precisely why we are in a situation again where so many factors after we win two games still have to go our way. Not an ideal scenario to be a part of, especially when we have won the second game of the season and we had those losses on the trot. Couple of close games, but still we were outplayed in most of those games (earlier in the tournament.) We just had a honest chat in the changing room that’s not good enough. Playing at this level we need to pull up our socks and need to be more brave with the ball and bat. I think the starting point was Kolkata where we came out and bowled that way in the powerplay, kept hunting for wickets and that game went down to the wire. That gave us more belief that this is the kind of cricket we want to play. It came to a point where we were like you know what, don’t look at the table and play for self respect. We as cricketers have gone through such hardships and such a long journey to be at this level, so we can’t go out there and play in a way that doesn’t make yourselves proud and the fans as well. They turn out in huge numbers and we can’t keep disappointing them like this. So need to raise our level and play for our own pride as a team. The confidence came back, now we are on a roll but again you think what if this momentum had caught up just a week before, we wouldn’t have been in a position where we have to depend on so many factors.
PBKS spinners: 0/75 in 6 overs (ER 12.50) \nRCB spinners: 4/69 in 7 overs (ER 9.86)
10th successive season PBKS has failed to make it to the Play Offs

PBKS at home venues since 2023 Mohali: Mat 5 | Won 1 | Lost 4 Mullanpur: Mat 5 | Won 1 | Lost 4 Dharamsala: Mat 4 | Won 0 | Lost 4 PBKS are the only ones with a sub 40 win% at their home venue across the last two seasons.
Stats by Deepu Narayanan
That's all from our side from this game folks. We'll be back tomorrow for the live coverage of the match between Gujarat Titans and Chennai Super Kings. For now, it's goodbye from us. Good night!
